name: lastlarf
text: Are there any regular cast members who do not, on occasion, mess with the little otter's head?

name: wolfslice
text: I think this may be an actual depression based hallucination, rather than a prank.

name: dougthehead
text: Actually, I think Roast Beef is depressed enough that even his imaginary friends commit suicide.

name: lexsenthur
text: And it's all Beef's fault. :(

name: cracklewater
text: And one of his surviving imaginary friends is named after (or perhaps is ) the huge cemetery in Paris.

name: gouldgonewild
text: Ah yes, the Mr. Tears Memorial Cemetery. It is so beautiful.

name: cracklewater
text:
Indeed! The perfect place to bury Mr Mojo Risin - he was getting stretch marks and starting to tear a little around the gut area before he died in that bathtub.

Hold on ... does 'Tears' rhyme with 'stairs' or 'fears'?

name: gouldgonewild
text: Yeah

name: ghostd
text: Yeah, this isn't a case of Roast Beef messing with Phillipe, but rather Roast Beef being messed up. and Mr. Bear's usually pretty straight with him.

name: honesttom
text: Although Beef did not at any point tell Philippe that plants don't get pregnant when you touch them.

name: prolefeed5
text: I don't think Roast Beef is going along with it because he thinks it's funny, more just that he's bored and lonely...

name: saucy_jack
text: Beef just doesn't have the wherewithal to explain the situation to Philippe.

name: daklin
text: The very idea of imaginary friends named Woman-Man and Mr. Tears, given what we know of Roast Beef's undifferentiated state at birth, is absolutely fantastic.

name: epicurus
text:
Nice catch, I'd forgotten the connection there. But holy crap is that ever morbid and depressing. What do they look like, I wonder?

But strip is probably some of the worst insanity on Beef's part - I mean he knows they're imaginary right? Did he forget he's introducing them to Philippe while he "learns" of the suicides?

Just amazing.

name: dovey
text:
Quote:
what do they look like, I wonder?


When I think of Woman-Man, I always get the image of a total skeezed-out crack whore with heck of crummy boobs

name: spinynorman
text: No sir, ain't clicking that at work, thank ye kindly

name: spinynorman
text:
Oh wait, it's just an asset bar link.

...mmm, still doubtful...

name: ixalarx
text:
Holy Moses! You can have quotes on assetbar!
(That is the first one I have ever seen.)

name: mustakrakesh
text: The moment we put actual faces on them the moment this strip moves closer to Family Circus fame, all invisble Ida Know and Not Me runnin' away from a broken cookie jar. Naw man, just naw.

name: magb
text: Woman-Man and Mr. Tears are finally at peace.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Small Talk is a great name for a person. I would like to meet someone with that name.

name: ishuta
text: smalltalk is also the name of a programming language

name: chaika
text: That's some heavy duty depression when your imaginary friends kill themselves.

name: cailetshadow
text: My older brother had three imaginary girlfriends when he was little. Their names were Lisa, Chisa, and Mareesa. One day he came into the house and said they had been run over by a car. He never spoke of them again.

name: professoryes
text: This is an inexplicably beautiful story.

name: tekende
text: Inexplicably fucked up, more like.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: this one.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: (not this one.)

name: manxome
text:
My sister sat on mine; my imagination was vivid enough to conceputalize the gore squishing out in every direction as he was unmercilessly crushed. It was a Pikachu named John James.


Looking back now, it was pretty hilarious.

name: luckypyjamas
text: also when you have six imaginary friends

name: dusty
text: It's even stranger when you consider that these characters, with their blogs, newsletters and other unbelivably detailed aspects of their lives outside the strip, are in most senses Chris Onstads imaginary friends.

name: stonecrab
text:
Hell, they're MY imaginary friends!! I even imagine going to *live* there...
Damn, is that crazy or just lame?

name: stevegt500
text: where is Samuel H Invisible?

name: shoinan
text: Dude, Samuel H Invisible was hella rude, he'd never turn up to Phillipe's wedding.

name: nicolae
text: At the trailer, watching Beef's Granny.

name: professorhazard
text: You sound surprised that you don't see Samuel H. Invisible.

name: epicurus
text: I'll tell you where he's not: At the Doctor.

name: whuppins
text: Suicide as a verb. Props to the last panel.

name: tombsgrave
text: Solid win from Thigh Bone to "suicided?"

name: julia
text: Why is no one else impressed with 'Montmartre'?

name: zeroasalimit
text: A comment left by zeroasalimit was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by gogobrent, Julia, Darthemed)

name: jesler729
text:
Hee hee, three lames.

NUH-UH WE CAN SO

name: moth
text: Freddie Fractions: The imaginary friend nobody likes.

name: afronaut
text: Small Talk is a dick

name: ezcmac
text:
If the names Woman-Man and Mr. Tears are any indication of their imaginary personalities, I'm not surprised they suicided.

I'd have suicided myself real good like.

name: stereo
text: And if they weren't indications of their personalities, the way people acted around them would pretty much cause the same thing.

name: f1shst1ck
text: Interesting little pieces of Roast Beef in each one of those names

name: mountaindewtab
text: haha suicide as a verb

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Roast Beef's surprise coupled with the surrealist elements of the comic could make me almost believe his invisible friends really are just friends that are invisible, not imaginary. I realize that it's not really the case of course.
Brilliance either way going from a cute idea to.. panel 8. Hehe and poor Beef.

name: paperboy_2000
text: Philippe, as a wedding present to you, Montmartre has agreed to not slash his wrists during the toast.

name: crumpetsandtea
text: that is a hell of good present. much better than a toaster. For shame, Small Talk! When is a flower and an otter ever going to need a toaster?!

name: catgrl131
text:
Don't you slit your wrists at ME, you son of a bitch!
Philippe is five today! That is SPECIAL!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Philippe is married today! That is SPECIAL!

name: harletron
text: Woman-Man killed him/herself first, and Mr. Tears could not live without Him/her.

name: noper2
text: The fact that Roast Beef has an imaginary friend named Freddie Fractions is mind-blowing.

name: tekende
text: Imagining an invisible friend called Woman-Man is deeply frightening to me.

name: sleepyhead
text: is it me or does Beef smoke alot throughout this arc

name: shutup_shutup
text: He is stressed because he wants to tell Philippe the truth about the flower but doesn't know how to go about it.

name: miaou
text: If Beef were a petunia , he would probably consider all these backyard herbs to be all kinds of folks.

name: aliiis
text:
SO GOOD STRIP. I just re-found this because I was having a really shit day and it totally cheered me up . I'm not sure whether that is healthy but it surely did.
Roast Beef's shaking in horror!
